summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from December 2021 between Assistant U.S. Attorney (USANYS) and attorney Larry Fallek regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The prosecutor requests Fallek's availability to testify, and they arrange for him to come to the courthouse at 40 Foley Square. The emails also reference a property case involving Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Larry Fallek
persons.context: Attorney at Fallek & Fallek, PLLC, who is being contacted by the U.S. Attorney's Office to potentially testify at the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal trial 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell' for which Larry Fallek may be called to testify.

connections.description: Fallek is being asked to testify at Maxwell's criminal trial, indicating he possesses relevant information for the prosecution.
Prosecutor coordinating with Fallek regarding his potential testimony in the government's case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Ghislaine Maxwell Trial
events.description: The criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell is ongoing in December 2021, with the prosecution preparing witnesses.

events.title: Arrangement for Testimony
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office arranges for Larry Fallek to come to the courthouse to potentially testify in the Maxwell trial.

locations: 116 East 65th Street, New York, NY (referenced in property case 'Ghislane Maxwell Barr v. 116 East 65th Street LLC')
keyFacts: Attorney Larry Fallek was contacted by the U.S. Attorney's Office in December 2021 to potentially testify at the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal trial.
The correspondence shows coordination for Fallek to come to the federal courthouse at 40 Foley Square on short notice.
The emails reference a separate civil property case involving Ghislaine Maxwell: 'Ghislane Maxwell Barr v. 116 East 65th Street LLC.'
The document demonstrates the prosecution's active witness preparation during the Maxwell trial in late 2021.
